required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MRI Assessment of Impaired Glucose Metabolism in Alzheimer's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: MRI Assessment of Impaired Glucose Metabolism in Alzheimer's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Diseases of dementia are chronic, untreatable, and cause a massive burden of morbidity. In this proposal, we seek to tackle the problem of better, earlier, and more efficient diagnosis using deuterium metabolic imaging (DMI). The study is divided in two sub-studies: 1) optimization and simplification of DMI protocols, and 2) a cross-sectional study of DMI in Alzheimer's patients and healthy controls.

primary_outcome.description: Glucose concentration in whole-brain referenced to baseline scan (sub-study 1).
Lactate concentrations in whole-brain referenced to baseline scan (sub-study 1).
Glx concentrations in whole-brain referenced to baseline scan (sub-study 1).
Lactate/glx ratio in the tempo-parietal cortex (sub-study 2).
Lactate/glx ratio in the posterior cingulum (sub-study 2).

secondary_outcome.description: Simpler DMI quantifications, including reference to external phantoms and internal reference, in the same regions defined in primary outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of Deuterium Metabolic Imaging

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive tests from the records (sub study 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of Deuterium Metabolic Imaging
secondary_outcome.description: The Mini-Mental State Exam (0-30, 30 is best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive tests from the records (sub study 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of Deuterium Metabolic Imaging

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebrospinal fluid biochemistry from the records (sub study 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of Deuterium Metabolic Imaging

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebrospinal fluid biochemistry from the records (sub study 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of Deuterium Metabolic Imaging

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebrospinal fluid biochemistry from the records (sub study 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of Deuterium Metabolic Imaging

arm_group.description: Repeated MRI and DMI for simplification of protocols. Repeated within 6 +/- 2 weeks.
MRI and DMI to assess cerebral glucose metabolism. Single examination. Compared with PET.
MRI and DMI for comparison with AD patients.

intervention.description: MRI after oral administration of 75g of [6,6'-2H2]glucose.

study_pop.textblock: In sub-study 1, the population is composed of healthy volunteers. In sub-study 2, patients with Alzheimer's disease and healthy age-matched controls are recruited.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
AD-patients:
- Aged 55-85 years.
- Male or female.
- AD diagnosis by the NIA-AA 2011 research criteria.8
- Able to give written informed consent.
- Mini-mental state examination (MMSE) equal to or above 18.9
- Brain FDG-PET performed at Aarhus University Hospital consistent with AD.
Healthy participants:
- Aged 18-85 years.
- Male or female.
Exclusion criteria:
All participants:
- Diabetes or any other metabolic disease.
- Other significant brain disease:
- Strokes.
- Tumors.
- Chronic small vessel disease (clinically suspected, or Fazekas ≥ 2 if clinical MRI is available).
- Epilepsy.
- Other neurodegenerative or -inflammatory disease.
- Contraindications for MRI:
- Pacemaker, neurostimulator or cochlear implant.
- Metal foreign bodies such as fragments and irremovable piercings.
- Unsafe medical implants (safety of heart valves, hips and the like must be confirmed).
- Claustrophobia.
- Largest circumference including arms > 160 cm.
- Pregnant - women must be post-menopausal or confirmed non-pregnant by an onsite test.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared after study completion and full anonymization.
